body_html:
I'm having the same issue. The follow files we created using a tf.estimator checkpointing on S3.

2018-11-09 11:49:00        133 checkpoint
2018-11-09 11:49:56   22748845 events.out.tfevents.1541779585.76ea0bf64a92
2018-11-09 10:06:42    4322097 graph.pbtxt
2018-11-09 11:09:04  188348504 model.ckpt-1124.data-00000-of-00001
2018-11-09 11:09:07      16509 model.ckpt-1124.index
2018-11-09 11:09:10    2100949 model.ckpt-1124.meta
2018-11-09 11:42:34  188348504 model.ckpt-1699.data-00000-of-00001
2018-11-09 11:42:37      16509 model.ckpt-1699.index
2018-11-09 11:42:39    2100949 model.ckpt-1699.meta
2018-11-09 11:48:58  188348504 model.ckpt-1814.data-00000-of-00001
2018-11-09 11:49:00      16509 model.ckpt-1814.index
2018-11-09 11:49:02    2100949 model.ckpt-1814.meta

Attempting to call

meta_graph_def = tf.saved_model.loader.load(sess, [tf.saved_model.tag_constants.SERVING], 's3://path_to_checkpoints')

raises the following error.

OSError: SavedModel file does not exist at: s3://path_to_checkpoints/{saved_model.pbtxt|saved_model.pb}

I am able to view the weights but unable to load with this tool

body:
I'm having the same issue. The follow files we created using a tf.estimator checkpointing on S3.
```                           PRE eval/
2018-11-09 11:49:00        133 checkpoint
2018-11-09 11:49:56   22748845 events.out.tfevents.1541779585.76ea0bf64a92
2018-11-09 10:06:42    4322097 graph.pbtxt
2018-11-09 11:09:04  188348504 model.ckpt-1124.data-00000-of-00001
2018-11-09 11:09:07      16509 model.ckpt-1124.index
2018-11-09 11:09:10    2100949 model.ckpt-1124.meta
2018-11-09 11:42:34  188348504 model.ckpt-1699.data-00000-of-00001
2018-11-09 11:42:37      16509 model.ckpt-1699.index
2018-11-09 11:42:39    2100949 model.ckpt-1699.meta
2018-11-09 11:48:58  188348504 model.ckpt-1814.data-00000-of-00001
2018-11-09 11:49:00      16509 model.ckpt-1814.index
2018-11-09 11:49:02    2100949 model.ckpt-1814.meta
```
Attempting to call 
```python
meta_graph_def = tf.saved_model.loader.load(sess, [tf.saved_model.tag_constants.SERVING], 's3://path_to_checkpoints')
```
raises the following error.
```python
OSError: SavedModel file does not exist at: s3://path_to_checkpoints/{saved_model.pbtxt|saved_model.pb}
```
I am able to view the weights but unable to load with this tool
